Computational Imaging is a dynamic and rapidly evolving field at the intersection of artificial intelligence, computer vision, image reconstruction, applied mathematics, and the physical sciences. The Computational Imaging Group (CIG) develops cutting-edge algorithms and theoretical frameworks for fast, robust, and high-fidelity acquisition, processing, and interpretation of imaging data—ranging from 2D images to 3D volumes and 4D dynamic sequences. Our work addresses challenges across a range of applications, including biomedical imaging, materials science, remote sensing, space exploration, industrial inspection, and consumer imaging. We specialize in deep learning, large-scale optimization, inverse problems, and statistical inference, with a strong emphasis on the development of principled methods that generalize across tasks and domains. CIG’s research is deeply interdisciplinary, with active collaborations spanning optics, medicine, physics, materials science, and biology. Our goal is to advance the foundational algorithms and systems that will power the next generation of imaging and sensing technologies. Interested in doing research in CIG?
